sn22.57:1.3: The “seven” are the four noble truths from the previous discourse, plus the “gratification” triad from SN 22.26.
sn22.57:18.1: The verb “examine” (upaparikkhati) is frequently used for someone who has learned the teachings, then internally reflects on their meaning.
sn22.57:18.2: These three, along with the aggregates, are the major wisdom topics, mentioned together also at MN 115:3.3. More commonly, the aggregates, sense fields, and elements are mentioned as a summary of the Buddha’s wisdom teachings (SN 8.12:3.2, SN 35.31:1.21, Thig 5.8:2.2, etc.).
